column1: #Text=US President George W. Bush has arrived in Israel - the first stop on a Middle East journey designed to bolster the Israeli- Palestinian peace process and foster unity on Iran .
#Text=Israel 's leaders were waiting at Ben Gurion Airport , as Air Force One taxied to a stop .
#Text=They formed a long welcoming line as George W. Bush set foot on Israeli soil for the first time in his presidency .
#Text=If there needs to be a little pressure then you know I will provide it .
#Text=Following a discussion with Ehud Olmert , the Israeli Prime Minister , George Bush said he would provide pressure if necessary .
#Text=He made this clear by saying " If there needs to be a little pressure then you know I will provide it , " after the talks .
#Text=He spoke of the strong ties between the United States and Israel .
#Text=He says the source of that strength is a shared belief in the power of human freedom .
#Text=" We will do more than defend ourselves .

#Text= From the very beginning , your policies have reflected a basic understanding of the challenges facing Israel in this troubled region and a solid commitment to our national security , " he said .

column1: #Text=It fell to Israeli President Shimon Peres , who is considered by some to be largely ceremonial , to offer some tougher talk .
#Text=He said President Bush is right to urge the world to pay attention to the threat posed by Iran .
#Text=" We take your advice not to underestimate the Iranian threat .
